org.agilewiki.utils.virtualcow

Class Db

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.BladeBase
      • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.IsolationBladeBase
        • org.agilewiki.utils.virtualcow.Db
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.Blade, org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.IsolationBlade

    public class Db
extends org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.IsolationBladeBase
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A database that supports multiple blocks.

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        In the form (currentTimeMillis() << 10) | index, the timestamp reflects the time this object was created or the time of the last transaction. (The index is added to make the timestamp unique.)
        Returns:
        The latest timestamp.

      • _setTimestamp

        Parameters:

        Open the db, creating a new db file.

      • update

        public org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.BladeBase.AReq<java.lang.String> update(java.lang.String transactionName,
                                                                                 MapNode tMapNode)
        Update the database.
        Parameters:
        transactionName - The registered name of the transaction class.
        tMapNode - The map holding the transaction parameters.
        Returns:
        The request to perform the update.

      • update

        public org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.BladeBase.AReq<java.lang.String> update(java.nio.ByteBuffer tByteBuffer)
        Update the database. First deserialize the map list held by the byte buffer, then fetch the name of the transaction class assigned to the key transaction_class_name. Then instantiate the transaction and call the transform method. The database is updated on successful completion of the transaction.
        Parameters:
        tByteBuffer - Holds the serialized transaction which will transform the db contents.
        Returns:
        The request to perform the update.

      • getJEName

        public java.lang.String getJEName()
        Returns the name of the journal entry being processed.
        Returns:
        The current journal entry name.

      • checkPrivilege

        public void checkPrivilege()
        Verifies that the thread is processing a transaction. Otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

      • isPrivileged

        public boolean isPrivileged()
        Returns true if the thread is privileged.
        Returns:
        True if a transaction is being processed.

        protected void _update()

      • open

        Open an existing database.

      • readRootBlock

        protected Db.RootBlock readRootBlock(long position)

      • allocate

        public int allocate()
        Allocates a block of disk space. But if not processing a transaction when called, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        The number of the block that was allocated.

      • usage

        public int usage()
        Returns the number of allocated pages. But if not processing a transaction when called, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        The number of pages in use.

      • release

        public void release(int i)
        Release a block. It will become available on the next transaction. But if not processing a transaction when called, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        i - The block to be released.
